definition: to give sb a demerit
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
(experienced action marker)

sentences.english: You get demerits if you miss a meeting .
sentences.chinese: 如果你缺席会议，会被记过的。

sentences.english: Both males and females have their merits and demerits.
sentences.chinese: 男性和女性有他们的优点和记过。

sentences.english: He already has three demerits on his record.
Students who make misprision or forswear shall be given the punishment of serious warning or demerit recording.
sentences.chinese: 知情不报或作伪证者，给予严重警告或记过处分。

sentences.english: He gets gigged for being ten minutes late.
sentences.chinese: 他因迟到十分钟而受到记过处分。

sentences.english: In high school, he was suspended for being late too many times.
sentences.chinese: 在高中，他因为迟到太多次而被学校记过停学。

definition: to expel from school
to play truant/to cut classes
to discipline sb/to punish/disciplinary action/to deal with (a matter)/CL:個|个[ge4]
to eliminate/to sack/to remove from office
lack of discipline/to break a rule/to violate discipline/to breach a principle
to expel (a member of an organization)/to fire (an employee)
to demote (to a lower rank)
to skip class
to leave early (before the stipulated finishing time)/to retire early (from one's job)
to deduct marks (when grading school work)/to have marks deducted/penalty points/to lose points for a penalty or error
to repeat a year in school
to put in detention (a soldier, a pupil)
to be criticized/to suffer blame
school rules and regulations
to be made to stand still as a punishment
to be absent from work or school
